differential_diagnosis: Iron-deficiency anemia due to gastrointestinal bleeding
Celiac disease associated with H. pylori infection (previous)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with long-standing iron-deficiency anemia and acute abdominal pain that resolved after altitude changes during a flight. Despite extensive evaluation for gastrointestinal causes, no source of chronic bleeding was identified until serologic testing and biopsy confirmed celiac disease, evidenced by marked villous blunting in the duodenal biopsy.
